item.description: The Return of the Native is one of the best of Thomas Hardy’s Wessex novels—and just an old-fashioned good read. This is no drawing-room comedy. Hardy sets his characters cinematically under the sun and moon on the English heath. When the educated, worldly Clym Yeobright returns from Paris to his rustic home he sets in motion a drama of mismatched romance, thwarted ambition, frustrated passion, and misunderstandings—all set amid the charm and idiocy of country life. Join us for a discussion.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the book on the table.

group.name: Classic Books: Book Club for Die-hard Readers

item.name: Hardy: The Return of the Native
